body_html: IIRC, these dependencies are inherited from BoringSSL via gRPC. We currently avoid this problem by building only the grpc++_unsecure target, which doesn't depend on BoringSSL. Presumably the same approach is possible here.
body_text: IIRC, these dependencies are inherited from BoringSSL via gRPC. We currently avoid this problem by building only the grpc++_unsecure target, which doesn't depend on BoringSSL. Presumably the same approach is possible here.
body: IIRC, these dependencies are inherited from BoringSSL via gRPC. We currently avoid this problem by [building only the `grpc++_unsecure` target](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/ba64f5334d4bba31d22c30e09a96f806ea0e2f7e/tensorflow/contrib/cmake/external/grpc.cmake#L43), which doesn't depend on BoringSSL. Presumably the same approach is possible here.
